html:
The Book of Mormon retains the words "against thee," in the first clause, clarifying that the gathering spoken of in this case is not the gathering of Israel, but the gathering of the wicked against the Lord's people. The Lord gives the assurance here that his people will prosper.

Behold, they shall surely gather together, but not by me: whosoever shall gather together against thee shall fall for thy sake. (Isaiah 54:15.) Behold, they shall surely gather together against thee, not by me; whosoever shall gather together against thee shall fall for thy sake. (3 Ne. 22:15.)
